creator: dshort@san.rr.com
text:
Problem:

If war file contains activation.jar and mail.jar files and common\lib also
contain the same files, Tomcat generates the following error when
transport.send(msg) is called:

java.lang.ClassCastException: javax.mail.Session


Solution/Work Around:

Remove activation.jar and mail.jar from war file.


.war file generated in NetBeans 5.5 IDE


Environment:

Pentium 4 (3.4 Mhz)
2 GB memory
Windows XP Pro SP2
MySQL 5.1
Apache 2.2.4
Mod_jk 2.2.4
Tomcat 5.5.23 (port 8084)
Java 1.5.0_11-b03

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
This works for me with a simple test case. There are, however, some more complex
use cases where the jars should only be in common/lib and having the jars in
both locations will cause this issue. The information in this report points to
an application configuration/deployment issue rather than a Tomcat bug.

(In reply to comment #1)
> This works for me with a simple test case. There are, however, some more complex
> use cases where the jars should only be in common/lib and having the jars in
> both locations will cause this issue. The information in this report points to
> an application configuration/deployment issue rather than a Tomcat bug.

Yes, this is a configuration issue but, shouldn't Tomcat still function
regardless  if the .jar files are loaded in two places?
creator: dshort@san.rr.com
